title.narrative: NP Modernization of Rani Jamara Kulariya Irrigation Scheme - Phase 1

description.narrative: The project development objective is to improve irrigation water delivery to, and management in, the command area. The command area is defined as the agricultural lands to be irrigated using infrastructure to be modernized under the project.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I, A.1 | Description :The Recipient shall establish, and thereafter maintain, the ProjectSteering Committee, to be chaired by the Secretary of the Recipient’s Ministry of Irrigation, to provide overall policy guidance. |Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I, B.1 | Description :The Recipient shall maintain a Project Implementation Manual, in formand substance satisfactory to the Association. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I, C.1 | Description :The Recipient shall ensure that the Project is carried out inaccordance with the provisions of the Governance and Accountability Action Plan. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I, D.1 | Description :The Recipient shall carry out the Project in accordance with theEnvironmental Management Plan and the Social Impact Management Framework. | Frequency :Yearly

title.narrative: Increase in irrigated crop yields of main crops rice, wheat, and maize in about 40% of the command area, at the head of the canal systems.
Number of farmer field schools and demonstrations implemented (annual number).
Water users provided with new/improved irrigation and drainage services (number)
No of WUA members trained (annual number).
Road Bridges, drops, siphons, etc. on feeder canal
Number of female and male water users (defined as member of the WUA) provided with improved water delivery services.
Technologies demonstrated in the project areas (number)
Water users provided with irrigation and drainage services - female (number)
Client days of training provided - Female (number)
Number of Executive Committee meetings and General Assembly meetings held per WUA (Annual, not cumulative).
Percentage of female WUA Executive Committee members.
Agriculture Service Center and Agriculture Contact Points active and providing advisory services.
Resources generated by water users for the operation and maintenance of the modernized irrigation systems (measured in percentage of required resources).
Irrigation service delivery by service providers (WUAs) assessed as satisfactory by water users (measured in percentage of water users).
